title: Verstappen wins LV GP; closes in on DQ'd Norris
content: Max Verstappen claimed his second Las Vegas Grand Prix ahead of championship leader Lando Norris to keep his slim championship chances alive.

title: Lanning swipes at SEC, touts Ducks' case for CFP
content: Dan Lanning allowed himself to do some CFP politicking after Oregon registered its 10th win of the season, a 42-27 victory over USC.

title: Klay claps back at Morant's postgame trash talk
content: After their verbal confrontation following Saturday's game, the Mavericks' Klay Thompson ripped Ja Morant, saying the Grizzlies star "has a lot to say all the time, especially for someone who rarely takes accountability."

title: Manning makes Texas history after snagging TD
content: Arch Manning became the first Longhorns player to catch, throw and rush for a touchdown on a night in which he accounted for six scores.

title: Falcons' Penix set for ACL reconstruction surgery
content: The Falcons must begin to make QB plans for the 2026 season with Michael Penix set to undergo ACL reconstruction surgery.

title: Shanahan hopeful but admits Aiyuk case 'unusual'
content: Niners coach Kyle Shanahan alternated between offering insight and declining to provide specifics on wide receiver Brandon Aiyuk's status with the team, a situation that he characterized as "extremely unusual."

title: UAB: Player arrested after stabbing 2 teammates
content: A UAB football player was arrested after stabbing two of his teammates Saturday morning at the football facility ahead of the Blazers' home game against USF, a school spokesperson confirmed.

title: KSU's Klieman emotional, defiant after close loss
content: An emotional Chris Klieman said he was gutted after a 51-47 loss to No. 12 Utah, one of several close defeats the banged-up Wildcats have been dealt this season.

title: Final prep for NFL Week 12: We have sleepers, QB questions, trends to watch and more
content: Will the Browns lean on the run in Shedeur Sanders' first start? Will Eagles-Cowboys come down to Jalen Hurts? Is Michael Wilson startable in fantasy?

title: How McLaren's microscopic DQ boosted Verstappen's title hopes
content: A technical infraction as small as a hair's width saw both McLarens disqualified, with major ramifications.

title: NC State's bizarre punt recovery and a salute to a surgeon headline college football Week 13 superlatives
content: A Wolfpack punter somehow recovered his own punt, which easily made this week's college football superlatives.

title: Week 12 inactives: Status for Josh Jacobs, Chris Godwin Jr. and others
content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

title: Week 12 betting guide: Picks for Colts-Chiefs; prop plays on Shedeur, Lamar and more
content: Our experts dive in to the lines and player props that offer value for Week 12 and share their tips and bets.

title: Zero interceptions: Jets can make history Sunday if they fail to make a pick
content: New York ranks sixth in pass breakups, so defenders are around the ball but just can't seem to grab it.

title: Can Cincy trio best Miami's Fab Four?
content: Lionel Messi and Co. face a tough road trip in the conference semis. Also on Sunday, Philly hosts NYCFC.

title: Inside the art of blocking a kick in the NFL: 'They're game changers'
content: The league has seen an uptick in blocked kicks, and ESPN's NFL Nation shares how players have done it.

title: WNBA mock draft: There's a new No. 1 replacing Lauren Betts at the top
content: Four UCLA players, including Lauren Betts, are now projected first-round picks. But Spain's Awa Fam is No. 1.

title: NBA first-month lessons: What we're hearing on all 30 teams
content: Tim Bontemps takes the pulse of the league on OKC's chase for 70 wins, the potential post-Trae Hawks and more first-month standout storylines.

title: Pete Alonso's three most aggressive suitors so far -- and a few other fits for the free agent first baseman
content: For a second straight winter, the Mets' franchise home run king is seeking a long-term deal. Where might he land?

title: Should the Tigers trade Tarik Skubal? We asked around MLB
content: Will the best pitcher in baseball be on the move this offseason? Those in the game offer their advice.

title: Videos show police search for Marshawn Kneeland before death
content: The Texas DPS released hours of video footage that details their search for Dallas Cowboys defensive end Marshawn Kneeland before he was found dead.

title: A year after Ruben Amorim's debut with Man United, things are finally turning around
content: Ruben Amorim's first game as Man United boss came a year ago, on Nov. 24, a 1-1 draw that showed how much work he had to do to turn the team around. A year on, there is proof of positive progress.

title: Chelsea pass Burnley test, but Barcelona and Arsenal await in a big week
content: Chelsea weren't at their best vs. Burnley, but they'll need a bit more when facing Barcelona and Arsenal next.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal lead Premier League trio in Yildiz chase
content: Arsenal want to sign Juventus star Kenan Yildiz before other Premier League clubs do. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Consensus on most recommendations of Assam Accord Clause 6: State govt.
content: The clause deals with the implementation of constitutional, legislative, and administrative safeguards for the indigenous people

title: SIT inches closer to fixing legal liability for chartering Sabarimala artefacts for private worship
content: Video footage show main suspect Unnikrishnan Potti offering puja to gold-plated panels covering the doorway of the sanctum sanctorum and the moulds of Dwarapalakas on the premises of wealthy patrons

title: BJP asks J&K Lt. Governor to bar admission of Muslim students at Mata Vaishno Devi varsity, evokes sharp reaction
content: A BJP delegation submitted a memorandum to L-G Manoj Sinha after the MBBS admission list for 50 seats featured 42 Muslims

title: Three, including a couple,  electrocuted as power cable falls on them in Cuddalore district
content: Owing to heavy rain and strong winds, a tamarind tree uprooted and fell on an overhead power cable, which snapped and fell on the three sitting in front of their house at Sathamangalam. They died on the spot

title: Andhra Pradesh outlines ₹66,523 crore PPP plan to boost urban infrastructure by 2029
content: Municipal Administration and Urban Development Department plans five smart cities, ₹35,000 crore FDI inflows, and 33 PPP projects as the State pushes large-scale reforms and new financing models, says a senior official

title: Telangana Rising 2047 vision document powered by three foundational enablers
content: Success of the ambitious vision document would be powered by tech and innovation, efficient financing, and good governance

title: Maoists bandh against Maredumilli encounters peaceful on tri-State border
content: Operation Sambhav aimed at eliminating Chhattisgarh Maoists who entered Maredumilli agency remains active

title: AIKS stages protest in Kalaburagi seeking urgent relief for farmers
content: Heavy rain has devastated both commercial and food crops across several districts, according to the district unit president of the sabha

title: BCU to teach foreign languages to medical, dental, nursing students of RGUHS
content: There is a huge demand for skilled doctors, nurses, and allied health professionals in the global healthcare sector

title: Top ULFA(I) leader surrenders on Myanmar border
content: Arunodoi Dohutia, one of the last extremists from northeastern region to have trained in Pakistan, has been a close aide of ULFA(I) chief Paresh Baruah

title: State will recommend Scheduled Tribes status for five communities before the end of Winter Session, says MLC
content: ‘The State govt. has promised to recommend to the Centre to grant Scheduled Tribes status to Koli, Kabbaliga, Besta, Ambiga, Mogaveera’

title: CPI seeks immediate release of ₹6,400 crore fee arrears in Andhra Pradesh
content: The party State secretary alleges that the prolonged delay in clearing dues is hurting students and forcing colleges across the State to shut down

title: UP Man Kills Woman, 60, Who Allegedly Pressured Him To Marry Her: Cops
content: A man accused of strangling a 60-year-old woman to death for allegedly pressuring him to marry her was arrested on Sunday, police said.

title: Jaish Module Was Going To Get Long-Range Drones From Pak Handler: Sources
content: The doctors and other individuals arrested as part of Jaish-e-Mohammed's white-collar terror module were to receive a consignment of long-range drones from a Pakistani handler, according to sources.

title: "Sindh May Return To India": Rajnath Singh's "Borders May Change" Remark
content: The Sindh region may not be with India today, but borders can change and the region may return home to India, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said at an event.

title: UP Man Accused Of 17-Year-Old Girl's Abduction Found Dead In Pond: Cops
content: A man accused of abducting a 17-year-old girl was found dead under mysterious circumstances in a pond here on Sunday, a day after his clothes and a purported suicide note were recovered from the spot, police said.

title: Canada To Revise Law For Citizenship By Descent. How It Affects Indians
content: Canada is set to modernise its citizenship rules, which could benefit thousands of Indian-origin families and other Canadians born abroad.

title: Air Force Officer's Final Goodbye To Husband Killed In Tejas Crash At Dubai Air Show
content: Surrounded by family members, Wing Commander Afshan on Sundaypaid her last respects to her husband, Wing Commander Namansh Syal, who lost his life in a Tejas fighter jet crash during the Dubai Air Show.

title: BJP Demands Rollback Of 42 Muslim Students' Admission To J&K Medical College
content: The Jammu and Kashmir unit of BJP has strongly opposed the admission of Muslim students to Mata Vaishno Devi Medical College in Katra, demanding an immediate rollback.

title: 'DMK's Ideology Is Looting': Actor Vijay In First Public Event After Karur Stampede
content: Nearly two months after the Karur stampede tragedy, TVK chief Vijay resumed his public outreach programme, addressing supporters in an indoor meeting with restricted entry.

title: 'We Did Our Part': Chief Justice Puts Creamy Layer Ball In Centre's Court
content: The Supreme Court has done its bit to address the creamy layer issue in caste-based reservation, and it is now up to the government and Parliament to take the next step, Chief Justice of India BR Gavai said today

title: Vietnam Flooding Kills 90, People Stranded On Roofs, Highways Blocked
content: Heavy rain, severe flooding and landslides in Vietnam have killed at least 90 people in the last week, authorities said, leaving others stranded on rooftops and mountain roadways blocked.

title: Singapore Deports Australian Man Over Ariana Grande Incident
content: Singapore deported an Australian man at the end of a nine-day jail term for rushing film star Ariana Grande during the Asian premier of "Wicked: For Good", local media reported.

title: Pakistan Fails In Perception Game Yet Again. French Navy Busts Their Lies
content: Struggling to create a perception that its military is better than India's, the Pakistani media didn't hold back from using fake news to claim that the May conflict reflected their air superiority.

title: X's 'About This Account' Feature Faces 'Accuracy' Complaints By Users
content: Social media platform X has begun rolling out a new feature called "About this account", which displays the location of a profile, its creation date, and the frequency of username changes.

title: Pilot Accused Of Sexual Assault By Crew Member In Bengaluru, Charged
content: A case was registered against the pilot of a chartered flight here for allegedly sexually assaulting a 26-year-old cabin crew member in a hotel in Bengaluru, police said on Sunday.

title: 2 Killed As Speeding Dumper Rams Motorcycle In Jaipur
content: Two men were killed after their motorcycle was hit by a speeding dumper truck near the Transport Nagar tunnel here on Sunday morning, police said.

title: Nitish Kumar Swearing In Ceremony Highlights: Nitish Kumar Takes Oath As Bihar Chief Minister
content: Bihar Chief Minister Oath Ceremony Live: JD(U) supremo Nitish Kumar sworn-in as Bihar chief minister for a record 10th time.

title: Study In Bihar Finds Uranium In Breastmilk. Top Scientist Punctures Scare
content: In a reassuring statement that addresses concern over a study that found uranium in the breastmilk of lactating mothers in Bihar, a senior scientist and member of National Disaster Management Authority has said the study's findings pose no concern

title: "How Is It A Threat?" Ajit Pawar On 'You Have Votes, I Have Funds' Remark
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar, while campaigning for local elections, told voters that he would release funds he had promised only if all of his party's candidates were elected.

title: "Punjab Comes First": State BJP Chief Picks His Side Amid Chandigarh Uproar
content: Amid the political uproar in Punjab over the Centre's move to bring Chandigarh under the President's direct control, Punjab BJP chief Sunil Jakhar has said Chandigarh is an "integral part of Punjab" and assured that the "confusion" will be resolved

title: Actor Vijay Holds 1st Public Outreach Event In Tamil Nadu After Karur Tragedy
content: The actor-turned-politician, who has kept away from public events after 41 people died in a stampede during his Karur rally, delivered a sharp political speech aimed at the ruling DMK.

title: Various factors driving young shepherds away from shepherding, say community elders
content: The desire among rural youth to live in the cities among urban amenities, erratic rain patterns, destruction of grazing land, diverting public spaces for non-farm activities cited among reasons

title: Some media outlets and TDP trying to undermine democracy, alleges YSRCP
content: Ponnavolu says parts of the media have crossed constitutional limits and are attempting to influence state authority, warning that provocative commentary and personal attacks will face firm action

title: 12 traders booked for using unstamped weighing machines
content: Officials registers cases under Section 8/25 and 30 of Legal Metrology Act and impose a fine of ₹90,000 on them

title: G20 Summit: PM Modi calls for global compact on AI to prevent misuse
content: PM Modi was addressing the third session of the G20 Summit on the topic – "A Fair and a Just Future for All - Critical Minerals; Decent Work; Artificial Intelligence”

title: First limestone block auction to be launched in Jammu
content: It is also the first mining block auction taking place in the Union territory since the implementation of the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Act  in 2015

title: Bengaluru techie loses ₹48 lakh to fake ‘sexual wellness’ cure, quack and associate booked for cheating
content: A man called “Vijay Guruji” prescribed him a so-called herbal product named “Devaraj Booti” which cost ₹1.6 lakh per gram and “Bhavana Booti Taila”, costing ₹76,000 per gram. The victim’s recent medical tests have reportedly revealed kidney damage, which doctors say could be due to unsafe substances in the consumed products.

title: Travel operators urge Karnataka government to resume safaris as livelihoods hit
content: Safari operations in both tiger reserves were halted earlier this month following a series of tiger attacks in the H.D. Kote and Sargur regions.

title: ‘First announce, second think’: Congress comments after MHA says Chandigarh bill not to be brought in Winter Session
content: This came a day after a bulletin of Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha listed the Constitution (131st Amendment) Bill 2025 among the provisional list of 10 bills for the upcoming session beginning December 1.

title: Treat singers promoting gang lifestyle through music, videos as criminals: Haryana DGP
content: Notably, the Haryana Police had earlier this year initiated action against songs that allegedly promote gun culture, "glorify" violence, and incite hatred

title: Election authorities to check suspected entry of minors’ names on voters’ list in Kozhikode
content: The details of six students, whose names were reportedly added after alleged Aadhar card alteration, have been submitted to the election authorities for action

title: Vice-President urges Civil Services Trainees to lead Viksit Bharat @2047 with team excellence
content: Laws are meant for societal welfare and must be enforced effectively by administrators, the responsibility of upholding the rule of law rests squarely on the administrators, the Vice President said

title: A.P. Tenant Farmers’ Association questions government’s credibility ahead of State-wide outreach tour
content: Eighteen months have passed, and not a single promise has been implemented, the association leaders claimed

title: Nearly half of Tamil Nadu’s contingent for ‘Khelo India University Games 2025’ drawn from University of Madras
content: The 82-strong contingent from the University of Madras (UoM) would participate in nine disciplines of both individual and team events at the Games that begin on November 24.

title: Shivamogga agri-horticultural varsity develops new variety of rice, receives good response
content: The Keladi Shivappa Nayaka University of Agricultural and Horticultural Sciences is getting requests from the Governor’s office and from ministers and elected representatives for a new variety of rice - Sahyadri Sindhura

title: UNSC reforms no longer an option, but a necessity: PM Modi at IBSA meet
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi proposed institutionalising the IBSA NSA-level meeting to strengthen security cooperation among the three countries

title: Tamil Nadu government deputes SDRF teams to Thoothukudi, Tirunelveli districts over heavy rain prediction
content: While two SDRF teams have been deputed to Thoothukudi district, one SDRF team has been positioned in Tirunelveli district.

title: Over 5,000 Congress workers from Jharkhand to take part in Delhi rally against 'vote chori'
content: “They would also hold a demonstration against the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in various States,” say Jharkhand Congress president

title: Rathnakar reaffirms faith in Sathya Sai Baba’s continuous legacy
content: Just as bathing in the Ganga does not sanctify the river but purifies the individual, service through Sai institutions transforms the devotee more than the organisation itself, the managing trustee of Sri Sathya Sai Central Trust said

title: Political pressures prevent SUDA from taking up ₹20 crore worth developmental activities
content: Public representatives and their confidants have been putting pressure on SUDA officials for sanction of works under the nomination process so that they can select the contractors on their own, say sources

title: Grandeur marks Sathya Sai Baba’s centenary; Vice President, Chief Minister, TG Chief Minister pay tributes
content: At a time when society is challenged by division, Baba’s teachings of love, unity and service hold greater urgency, the Vice President said

title: Man held for threatening BLO over dispute in filling up voter's SIR form
content: BLO Deepak Mahato had first submitted a written complaint to the Block Development Officer and later lodged a complaint at Nazat Police Station, alleging that Molla threatened him over the phone, says the police

title: ITBP to establish 10 all-women border outposts along India-China LAC
content: The ITBP, with a manpower of more than one lakh personnel, has its border posts ranging between the height of 9,000 feet and over 14,000 feet, affected by inclement weather and low levels of oxygen

title: Bengaluru ATM van robbery: Home Minister warns of dismissal of police personnel involved in crime
content: The Minister has issued strict instructions to senior police officers to remain vigilant and ensure discipline within the department.

title: PM Modi holds talks with South African President Ramaphosa, discusses cooperation in trade, critical minerals
content: The discussions focused on further cooperation in trade, investment, mining, critical minerals, AI, Digital Public Infrastructure, skill development and food security

title: Seventh accused in Bengaluru ATM van robbery case arrested
content: The police had earlier arrested six persons involved in the heist and recovered a total of ₹6.2 crore from them.

title: Proposal on Chandigarh doesn’t alter administrative structure, no final decision yet: MHA
content: The Constitution (131 Amendment) Bill 2025 seeks to include the Union Territory of Chandigarh in Article 240 of the Constitution of India, in alignment with other Union Territories

title: Four pilgrims from Madhya Pradesh killed in road accident
content: According to the police, the van in which they were travelling hit a stationary lorry, leading to the ghastly incident

title: TVK chief Vijay accuses DMK of abandoning Annadurai’s ideals
content: This  limited-access, indoor meeting at Sunguvarchathiram in Kancheepuram district marked the first public engagement of Mr. Vijay nearly two months after 41 persons died in a stampede at a political rally he addressed at Karur.

title: AIADMK general council, executive committee to meet on December 10
content: The meeting assumes significance in the backdrop of expulsion of senior leader and Gobichettipalayam MLA K.A. Sengottiayan

title: Gelatin sticks found near school in Uttarakhand’s Almora, investigation underway
content: “Preliminary investigations have ruled out any terrorist links, and it appears that the explosives were left behind by a contractor during construction of a road,” say Almora Senior Superintendent of Police

title: White collar terror module: Haryana preacher pleads with police to collect rent from doctors
content: Maulvi Ishtiyaq’s name surfaced during the interrogation of Dr. Muzammil Ganaie, a key member of the 'white-collar' terror module arrested from the University

title: Tamil Nadu government announces police honours for poet Erode Tamilanban's funeral
content: A Tamil teacher at New College, Chennai, the Sahitya Akademi Award recipient was also a newsreader with Doordarshan

title: SC to hear on November 24 plea challenging climate activist Sonam Wangchuk's detention
content: The plea said the unfortunate events of violence in Leh on September 24 cannot be attributed to the actions or statements of Mr. Wangchuk in any manner

title: After Akhilesh's charge on voter deletions, Maurya predicts Opposition setbacks in Bengal, U.P.
content: Akhilesh had alleges that the BJP and the Election Commission were conspiring to delete more than 50,000 votes in assembly segments where the SP and the INDIA bloc had won during the 2024 Lok Sabha polls

title: Justice Surya Kant to take oath as 53rd Chief Justice of India on November 24
content: Justice Kant was appointed as the next CJI on October 30 and will remain in the post for nearly 15 months

title: Kejriwal, Harsimrat oppose bill allowing President to make legislation for Chandigarh directly
content: The BJP-led central government's attempt to eliminate Punjab's rights over Chandigarh through constitutional amendment is not part of a simple move, but a direct attack on Punjab's identity and constitutional rights, says AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal

title: Fire breaks out at district hospital in M.P.'s Betul; patients shifted to safety
content: Patients from the female ward and the paediatric ward were shifted to safer areas as a precaution. The hospital staff later started the process of moving them back to their respective wards, the officials said

title: Illegal cough syrup trade: U.P. Police book 12 medical store owners
content: A drug department probe found that more than 37 lakh bottles of codeine syrup worth around ₹57 crore were shown as sold through forged documents by over a dozen medical stores

title: Man accused of drug peddling shot on knee by police near Chidambaram
content: The accused had nine cases including five ganja cases pending against him in various police stations in Cuddalore, Mayiladuthurai and Chennai.

title: Delhi air quality remains 'very poor', AQI stands at 381
content: The minimum temperature settled at 14°C, 2.7 °C above the season's average, while the humidity was recorded at 86% at 8.30 a.m., as per IMD.

title: Tejas crash at Dubai Air Show: Tributes paid to Wing Commander Namansh Syal at Sulur Air Force Station
content: The Wing Commander was attached to IAF's No. 45 Squadron (Flying Daggers) based at Air Force Station, Sulur, one of the two Squadrons operating Light Compact Aircraft (LCA) HAL Tejas

title: Four militants arrested in Manipur
content: Security forces arrested an active cadre of the proscribed PREPAK (PRO) from Moreh Gate in Tengnoupal district on November 21, say police

title: Two BLOs suspended for negligence during SIR in UP's Bahraich
content: The Election Commission of India expressed strong displeasure, terming the conduct of both officials a violation of service rules

title: Pakistan Defence Minister Asif condoles Indian pilot's death in Dubai Air Show crash
content: The Minister sharing Pakistan Strategic Forum’s message noted that “Unfortunately the IAF pilot wasn’t able to eject & hasn’t survived the crash.”

title: Nicholas Singh arrested: Indian-origin on Canada's 'most wanted' list nabbed after 18 mths
content: A fugitive of Indian origin, Nicholas Singh, has been apprehended in Toronto after an 18-month evasion. Previously on Canada's 'most wanted list,' Singh was serving a lengthy sentence for armed robbery and other offenses.  Authorities discovered him with a firearm, leading to new charges including illegal possession of a regulated weapon.

title: 'Sindh may return to India': Rajnath says 'borders can change'; cites civilisational link
content: Defence minister Rajnath Singh said borders can change and the Sindh region might rejoin India. highlighting country's long civilisational links with the region. Singh referenced L K Advani's views on Sindhi Hindus still not able to accept the separation. He added everyone who considers Indus river pious is our own.

title: 'Father's condition kept worsening': Smriti Mandhana–Muchhal wedding postponed
content: Smriti Mandhana and Palash Muchhal's wedding, slated for this Sunday in Sangli, has been indefinitely postponed due to the cricketer's father's ill health. The family is requesting privacy during this difficult time. The couple, who made their relationship public in July 2024, had planned an intimate ceremony. Their focus is now on the father's recovery.

title: Salute & tears: Wing Commander Afshan's emotional goodbye to husband Namansh Syal
content: Wing Commander Namansh Syal died in a Tejas fighter jet crash in Dubai. The aircraft crashed during an aerobatic demonstration. His mortal remains were brought to his native village in Himachal Pradesh. Villagers and family members paid emotional tributes. The Indian Air Force is investigating the cause of the mishap. This is the second Tejas crash since its induction.

title: 'Country in chaos': Rahul slams SIR after BLOs death; calls revision 'imposed tyranny'
content: Rahul Gandhi has alleged widespread "chaos" due to the special intensive revision of electoral rolls, claiming 16 Booth Level Officers died from work-related stress. He called the exercise an "imposed tyranny" and a "conspiracy" to protect those in power.

title: Nvidia’s rise: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon weighs in; warns some investors will lose money
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon praised Nvidia as an "unbelievable company" while cautioning that some AI stocks may be overvalued, drawing parallels to the dot-com era. He emphasized that AI is a real, transformative productivity revolution, despite current inflated valuations, and believes mankind will ultimately benefit from the technology.

title: What is China's illegal ‘996’ work culture that Narayana Murthy has pitched for India
content: Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy's suggestion of a 72-hour workweek, referencing China's "996" culture, has reignited debate. While China's "996" model powered its tech boom, it led to burnout and was eventually declared illegal due to its detrimental impact on workers' well-being.

title: India’s employability gap: What rising male gains and female fluctuations mean
content: The India Skills Report 2026 reveals a sharp shift in gendered employability trends, with men overtaking women in 2025 before women regained a narrow lead this year. The six-year swing highlights how technical-skill demand, systemic barriers, and divergent regional preferences shape workforce outcomes. The findings raise urgent questions about equity, access, and India’s preparedness for a gender-balanced labour market.

title: IND vs SA: Why KL Rahul will lead India in ODI series against South Africa - Explained
content: KL Rahul will captain India in the upcoming three-match ODI series against South Africa due to injuries to regular captain Shubman Gill and vice-captain Shreyas Iyer. The squad sees the return of Ravindra Jadeja and the inclusion of Tilak Varma in the middle order, while Jasprit Bumrah has been rested.

title: US arrests tech company CTO and three others for selling Nvidia's banned chips to China
content: Four individuals, including two American citizens and two PRC nationals residing in the U.S., have been charged with illegally exporting advanced Nvidia GPUs to China. The conspiracy involved falsifying paperwork and using a shell company to transship the sensitive technology, which has AI and military applications. The scheme aimed to circumvent U.S. export controls, with over $3.

title: No entry ever: Indian man visits Canada to see newborn grandchild, harasses teens
content: An Indian national, Jagjit Singh, visiting Canada on a temporary visa, has been convicted of criminally harassing two teenage girls near their school. Singh's actions, including attempting to take photos and putting his arm around a student, led to his arrest and a jail sentence following which he has been ordered to be deported and never to return to Canada.

title: McRae and Hughes quietly move from rumor-mill chatter to an online spectacle
content: A fan photo of Tate McRae and Jack Hughes in Manhattan sparked dating rumors, but Lexi Brown's humorous take on McRae's outfit, wearing Hughes' team colors, shifted the narrative. This playful interaction highlights McRae's embrace of hockey culture while Hughes recovers from a hand injury, offering fans an encouraging update on his well-being.

title: 'Nothing to say': Kharge on K'taka power tussle; Cong chief says high command will decide
content: Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah's tenure is under renewed speculation as the Congress government reaches its halfway mark. Party chief Mallikarjun Kharge stated the high command will decide on any leadership changes, while Siddaramaiah maintains the buzz is media-driven. Friction reportedly exists over a cabinet reshuffle, with supporters of Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar seeking clarity on leadership first.

title: $1 trillion squad: Musk, Zuckerberg, Pichai, and fellow billionaires break the internet
content: A viral AI-generated image of tech titans like Elon Musk and Mark Zuckerberg in a parking lot has captivated the internet. Dubbed the '$1 trillion squad,' the photo's cinematic style and the juxtaposition with a cheap motel room in a sequel image fueled a massive meme storm, reflecting 2025's AI-dominated landscape and the immense cultural power of tech leaders.

title: Bengaluru techie duped of Rs 48 lakh by fake Ayurvedic 'Guruji'; suffers kidney damage
content: A 29-year-old software engineer was allegedly defrauded of Rs 48 lakh by a self-proclaimed Ayurvedic healer and a medicine shop. The healer sold him costly herbal products, claiming they would cure his sexual health issues. The victim's health reportedly worsened after consuming the medicines, leading to kidney complications.

title: Chandigarh under Article 240: No bill this Winter Session; what the change would mean
content: The home ministry clarified that the proposed Constitution (131st Amendment) Bill for Chandigarh will not be introduced in the upcoming Winter Session. The government stated the Bill, aimed at simplifying law-making for the Union Territory, is still under consideration and no final decision has been made.

title: Bengaluru: Auto driver sets himself on fire during police routine check; tension in area
content: A 35-year-old auto driver in Chitradurga attempted self-immolation after alleging persistent harassment by traffic police during a drunk-driving check. He poured petrol on himself and set himself ablaze near Gandhi Circle, reportedly after being manhandled. Onlookers rescued him; he is in serious condition with 50 percent burns.

title: Explained: How new labour laws may cut take-home salary; raise PF & gratuity contributions
content: New labour codes effective November 21, 2025, mandate basic salary at 50% of CTC, potentially lowering take-home pay as retirement contributions rise. These unified laws aim to simplify compliance and boost worker safeguards. Expect higher provident fund and gratuity payments, impacting immediate earnings while enhancing long-term retirement security for employees.

title: From Bihar to Bengal: How SIR is reshaping voter rolls; a deep dive into how it works
content: India's voter rolls are undergoing a Special Intensive Revision (SIR), a nationwide exercise to ensure accuracy. While the Election Commission calls it crucial for democracy, political parties allege it's a politically motivated move to alter electoral outcomes, sparking debate and legal challenges. The process aims for clean rolls but faces opposition concerns.

title: Smriti wedding postponed: Who is Shriniwas Mandhana? Batter's father hospitalised
content: Smriti Mandhana's wedding, scheduled for Sunday in Sangli, has been indefinitely postponed due to her father, Shriniwas Mandhana, falling unwell. He was admitted to the hospital and is under observation. Shriniwas, a former district-level cricketer himself, had always supported his children's cricketing aspirations, with Smriti fulfilling his dream of playing for India.

title: 'Withdraw your son': Woman recalls Delhi boy’s last words; alleges teachers torture him
content: A Delhi school student, reportedly distressed and claiming teachers "tortured" him, died by suicide near Rajendra Place Metro Station. He left a note accusing teachers of harassment. The Delhi government has formed an inquiry committee, and the school suspended four staff members amid ongoing protests.

title: Michael Irvin is navigating a personal moment that has left him openly emotional
content: NFL legend Michael Irvin shared a personal moment of vulnerability, revealing his dog Aurora underwent ACL surgery. He drew parallels to his own past injuries and CeeDee Lamb's current situation, eliciting a wave of support and well wishes from fans. Supporters offered prayers, shared their own pet recovery stories, and expressed optimism for Aurora's healing.

title: India ODI squad: Rahul appointed skipper, Jadeja returns; Axar left out
content: India have named KL Rahul as captain for the three-match ODI series against South Africa starting November 30. The major selection talking point is Ravindra Jadeja’s return to the ODI squad after missing the Australia series, while Axar Patel has been left out.

title: Netanyahu shares article linking Epstein to Israeli intelligence
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu shared a controversial article from the socialist magazine Jacobin, alleging Jeffrey Epstein claimed to have meddled in Israel's elections and consulted former PM Ehud Barak. The piece, based on leaked texts, raises questions about Epstein's political ties and potential links to Israeli intelligence. Critics argue Netanyahu's action legitimizes anti-Israel narratives from a publication known for such content, potentially harming Israel's global standing.

title: 'Not option, but necessity': PM Modi calls for UNSC reforms at IBSA meet
content: Prime Minister Modi stressed the urgent need to reform the UN Security Council, urging India, Brazil, and South Africa to champion global governance overhauls. He advocated for enhanced security cooperation, including institutionalizing NSA-level dialogues, and proposed an 'IBSA Digital Innovation Alliance' for technology sharing. Discussions also covered climate resilience and South-South cooperation.

title: 'Fake news': French navy on Pak media reports on Op Sindoor; calls Rafale claims fabricated
content: The French Navy has debunked Pakistani media claims of a French officer confirming Pakistani air superiority and the downing of Indian Rafale jets. The Navy stated that Captain Yvan Launay never made such comments, clarifying his role was technical and he refused to comment on specific aerial engagements or Chinese systems.

title: Epstein controversy: Andrew makes rare public appearance since losing titles
content: In a surprising public appearance, Prince Andrew was spotted horseback riding, marking his first such outing since the loss of his royal titles amidst the ongoing scandal surrounding his connections to Jeffrey Epstein. While neighbors, Prince William and Princess Kate, seem committed to supporting him, King Charles appears less than pleased with the negative attention.

title: Can arterial plaque be reversed? Top US doc says...
content: Contrary to popular belief, arterial plaque buildup is often reversible without surgery, according to Dr. Vassily Eliopoulos. He emphasizes that "soft plaques" are the primary cause of heart attacks and can be addressed through precision testing, targeted nutrition, and lifestyle changes like diet, exercise, and sleep. This root-cause approach focuses on reducing inflammation and metabolic dysfunction to heal arteries.

title: Inside job: How a police constable 'trained' gang for Bengaluru's biggest cash van robbery; 6 held
content: Bengaluru police have arrested six individuals, including a police constable, in connection with a daring daylight heist of Rs 7.11 crore from a bank van.  A massive hunt across six states led to the recovery of Rs 6.29 crore, with the investigation highlighting insider involvement and meticulous planning by the gang.

title: 'No intention to ... ': MHA offers big clarification on Chandigarh bill
content: The Union home ministry clarified that the central government has no plans to introduce a bill altering Chandigarh's governance or administrative structure in the upcoming Parliament session. This statement followed a political controversy over a proposal to bring Chandigarh under Article 240 of the Constitution, which had sparked concerns about Punjab's rights over the city.

title: 'Not getting married without dad': Mandhana's father under observation; tests carried out
content: Smriti Mandhana's wedding to music composer Palash Muchhal, scheduled for Sunday in Sangli, has been indefinitely postponed. The decision comes as her father, Shrinivas Mandhana, was hospitalized due to health complications.  Mandhana's commitment to having her father present for the ceremony is paramount.  Several Indian women's cricket team members were already in Sangli for pre-wedding festivities.

title: Tejas crash: IAF pilot Namansh Syal’s mortal remains reach native village; last rites in Kangra
content: Wing Commander Namansh Syal, a decorated IAF pilot, tragically lost his life in a Tejas jet crash during the Dubai Air Show. His mortal remains were brought to his Himachal Pradesh village for final rites. Syal, a proud son of Kangra, was known for his bravery and dedication. The nation mourns this brave pilot.

title: Pant says 'maarne de usko', Muthusamy sends next ball over long-on - Watch
content: Senuran Muthusamy achieved his maiden Test century with a patient knock, supported by Marco Jansen's free-scoring at the other end, as South Africa neared 500. Indian captain Rishabh Pant's tactical guidance, including encouraging a big shot from Muthusamy, proved effective. Their partnership bolstered South Africa's strong first-innings position.

title: Cyclone 'Senyar' likely to form over Bay of Bengal: 10 key points
content: A low-pressure system over the Strait of Malacca is poised to intensify into a cyclonic storm in the Bay of Bengal next week. Early warnings are in effect for heavy rain and strong winds across the Andaman & Nicobar Islands.

title: How much water should you be drinking every day: Risks of dehydration
content: Kidneys balance the fluids and the salts in the bod, and keeps the urine clear. Clear urine means a lower chance of kidney stones and urinary infections. When you do not drink enough water, the kidneys have to work harder to make the urine more concentrated. That extra work can strain the kidneys over time

title: Mass kidnappings: Over 300 missing in Nigeria after armed raid on catholic school
content: Gunmen abducted over 300 students and teachers from a school in Niger state, Nigeria, marking one of the country's largest mass kidnappings. This incident follows a week of escalating abductions targeting both Christians and Muslims, with schools and churches being particularly vulnerable. Experts suggest these attacks are driven by criminal gangs seeking substantial ransom payments.

title: Bengaluru shocker: Pilot 'sexually assaults' cabin crew member at hotel; booked
content: A case has been filed against a chartered flight pilot for allegedly sexually assaulting a 26-year-old cabin crew member in Bengaluru. The victim, who is from Hyderabad, reported the incident at Begumpet Police Station, leading to a 'Zero FIR' being registered. The case has since been transferred to Bengaluru for further investigation.

title: 'You're not dumb, I am the one who trusted you': Bowler recalls what Dhoni said
content: Deepak Chahar recounted a tense moment from the 2019 IPL on Big Boss, where MS Dhoni entrusted him with death bowling against Sarfaraz Khan. Despite two initial no-balls, Chahar recovered, conceding five runs and taking a wicket in the remaining five deliveries to secure a win for Chennai Super Kings.

title: From Article 370 to Pegasus: Justice Kant set to take oath as CJI tomorrow; key cases
content: Justice Surya Kant, a distinguished judge, is set to become India's 53rd Chief Justice on Monday, succeeding Justice BR Gavai. With a tenure extending until February 2027, Justice Kant's career is marked by significant rulings on Article 370, sedition law, and Pegasus spyware. His contributions also span electoral transparency and gender justice within the legal fraternity.

title: Grand Udaipur wedding today: Trump Jr, Bollywood celebs to attend
content: US President Donald Trump Jr. joined celebrities like Jennifer Lopez and Justin Bieber in Udaipur for the wedding of US baron Rama Raju Mantena's daughter, Netra. The lavish event, held at Jag Mandir Island Palace, saw extensive security measures and performances by top artists, highlighting the Mantena family's significant connections.

title: Relief for Indian-origin families: Canada to overhaul citizenship-by-descent rules; check details
content: Canada's Citizenship Act is undergoing a significant overhaul with Bill C-3, poised to benefit thousands of Indian-origin families. This landmark legislation abolishes the "second-generation cut-off," restoring citizenship to those previously excluded and establishing a "substantial connection test" for future generations born abroad.  The law, awaiting its effective date, promises greater fairness and inclusivity for Canadian families.

title: 'Used as example of under-performer': Peers flag humiliation; Delhi student suicide case deepens
content: Classmates of a 16-year-old student who died by suicide have alleged he was repeatedly humiliated by teachers at St Columba's School. They claim his suicidal thoughts were dismissed by the school counsellor. Protests continue, demanding justice and a transparent investigation into the alleged harassment.

title: Ladakh violence: SC to hear plea against Sonam Wangchuk's detention on Nov 24
content: Sonam Wangchuk's wife challenges his detention under the NSA in the Supreme Court, calling it illegal and a violation of fundamental rights. The plea argues his arrest is based on stale allegations and aims to silence dissent, not address security. Wangchuk's wife also appealed to the President, alleging a 'witch-hunt'.

title: 'India backs early end to conflict': Jaishankar speaks to Ukraine counterpart
content: India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar spoke with his Ukrainian counterpart, reiterating New Delhi's call for an immediate end to the conflict and lasting peace. This comes amid complex developments, including a US proposal for peace and internal challenges faced by Ukraine. The conversation highlighted India's consistent diplomatic stance on the ongoing crisis.

title: 'Mazak bana rakha hai Test cricket ko': Pant's fiery message for Team IND star - watch
content: Stand-in captain Rishabh Pant's frustration was evident on Day 2 as India struggled against South Africa. Stump-mic recordings captured Pant urging his bowlers and fielders to maintain urgency and adhere to the over-rate timer, highlighting India's growing pressure.  Despite the team's efforts, South Africa's lower middle order continued to frustrate the hosts.

title: Turn the love up: Inside the odd bromance of Donald Trump and Zohran Mamdani
content: Nirmalya Dutta is an editorial consultant with The Times of India. He covers world news, pop culture, and philosophical memes. He writes the column Random Musings and The Weekly Vine, a newsletter that blends news, culture, and humour with a touch of chaos. He is also the co-creator of Meow Times, a satirical cartoon strip about the absurdities of corporate life. His political, moral, and economic views drift somewhere between woke-Leninist, Rand-Marxist, and Keynesian-Friedmanite, though he isn’t entirely sure what any of those terms mean. Read More

title: Projecting the College Football Playoff top 12 after Week 13
content: the Sooners beat the Tigers 17-6 in Norman . there wasn't any movement in this week's top 12 projection . a dominant win against a now sub.-500 team isn't going to change the way the committee views Ohio State as the most complete team in the country .

title: 👀 Texas-Arkansas roast tops college football trolls
content: the big rivalry games haven't arrived yet, but some college football teams still found time to troll their opponents in Week 13 . the Razorbacks won 52-37 over a struggling opponent, and the longhorns threw for 389 yards and four touchdowns .

title: 'This is not a beauty contest': Venables leads best quips of college football Week 13
content: a 17-6 win over Missouri keeps the CFP dream alive . the Tigers outgained the Sooners in total yardage 301-276 . a dominant second half by the defense kept the visitors at arm's . "it's not pretty, but this is not a beauty contest. this is football"

title: Dak Prescott poised to become Cowboys' career passing leader
content: dak Prescott would become the Dallas Cowboys' career passing leader . his predecessor, Tony Romo, had 34,183 yards in his career . "thankful to be healthy and to be in this position to do it," Prescott says .

title: Bring on Rivalry Week! Status quo Saturday means chaos looms
content: we had every right to expect Week 13 might deliver some twists and turns we didn't see coming . we might've hoped Missouri, with Beau Pribula back at quarterback, could've upended Oklahoma 's playoff dreams . the debate could have been settled by an upset from Syracuse or the Hokies .

title: Gotham rides series of magic moments to win NWSL championship
content: rose lavelle was the star of the moment as the final minutes ticked away at PayPal Park on sunday . the 1-0 win at the weekend saw the league's inability to retain its biggest star due to the limitations of the salary cap . saturday's NWSL Championship was dominated by distress over the future of the Washington Spirit forward .

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 12: Target the Brissett-Wilson combo in Arizona
content: field Yates, Daniel Dopp and Stephania Bell discuss Jacoby Brissett's fantasy performances since taking over for Kyler Murray . every Friday throughout the 2025 season, Matt Bowen will offer some late-week pickup options to fill those holes . there are a group of wide receivers providing both volume and upside worthy of consideration .

title: Our guide to every Week 12 game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: the Chiefs must win against the Colts and from here on out to stay in the playoff race . we have you covered with everything you need to know . our NFL Nation reporters take you inside the locker room with the best thing they heard this week .
